Question 71) In the capitalist system, the many manifestations of crisis create conditions that force some kind of rationalization. In general, these periodic crises have the effect of expanding productive capacity and renewing accumulation conditions. We can conceive each crisis as a change in the accumulation process to a new and higher level.
HARVEY, D. The capitalist production of space. The condition for the inclusion of workers in the new production process described in the text is the
A) Union Association.
B) electoral participation.
C) International migration.
D) professional qualification.
E) Functional regulation.
